doc.previous: Temples housed the cult images of deities often by famed sculptors 421 The religiosity of the Romans encouraged the production of decorated altars small representations of deities for the household shrine or votive offerings and other pieces for dedicating at temples Divine and mythological figures were also given secular humorous and even obscene depictions citation needed
